page.title: 12Fox hunting in Llangybi
page.content: The Llangybi Hunt is one of the oldest packs of foxhounds in the country and hunts on Tuesdays and Saturdays from November to April.The season closes with the point to point Steeplechase. The Hunt country extends Wentwood to Pontypool and from Gwehelog to Chepstow Road.The Mastership is shared by four members.The hunt kennels are situated in the village and there are thirty couple of hounds.There is traditionlly a meet on Boxing Day morning from the White Hart inn which attracts crowds of visitors to the village.The Hunt rides through Usk as part of the festivities at the victorian shopping day and appears at local shows such as the Usk Show and,in 1985,at the Royal Welsh Show.
